title: Add article caching layer
description:
Implement caching for generated articles:
- Store articles by slug in localStorage (for now)
- Cache lookup on article page load
- Cache write after generation
- Consider cache invalidation strategy for future

title: Implement URL-to-slug conversion
description:
Create a utility function to convert GitHub URLs to unique, URL-safe slugs:
- https://github.com/facebook/react → facebook-react
- Handle edge cases (trailing slashes, .git suffix, etc.)
- Ensure consistent slug generation (same URL → same slug)

title: Handle direct article URL access
description:
When a user visits /article/:slug directly:
- Check cache for existing article
- If cached: display article
- If not cached: show 'article not found' or redirect to homepage with URL pre-filled

This enables shareable links.

title: Add URL-based routing with React Router
description:
Install React Router and implement:
- / → Homepage
- /article/:slug → ArticlePage

The slug should be derived from the GitHub URL (e.g., github.com/user/repo → user-repo)

title: URL-to-article mapping with caching and shareability
description:
Each unique URL pasted into the homepage should map to a unique, shareable article URL. Pasting the same URL returns the cached version, and articles can be shared via their URL.

## Current State
- Simple useState view switching (no router)
- URLs passed but not actually used
- Article content is hardcoded
- No persistence, no caching

## Requirements
1. Unique article URLs derived from input URLs
2. Cache lookup for previously generated articles
3. Shareable article links that work when accessed directly
4. Same input URL → same cached article

title: Update Homepage to check cache before generating
description:
Modify Homepage flow:
- On URL submit, convert to slug
- Check if article exists in cache
- If cached: navigate directly to article (skip loading animation)
- If not cached: show generation flow, then cache result
